OP2: I warned my friend to be careful and that my dog might bite him.
OP3: I warn my friend to be careful and that my dog may bite him.
OP4: I warned my friend for being careful and that my dog might be biting him.
Solution:
The given sentence is in Direct Speech.
The given sentence is in Direct Speech because it quotes actual words. Therefore, it must be changed into Indirect Speech.
We notice that the reporting verb is in the Past tense (‘said’). Hence, a change will be made in the tense of the reported speech.
Also, the first person of the reported speech is changed according to the subject of reporting speech.
When we want to report a warning, we use a verb like 'warned' with a to-clause. The pattern is verb + indirect object + to-clause.
Therefore, the sentence in Indirect Speech will be option 2 i.e. I warned my friend to be careful and that my dog might bite him.

Question:
In the following question, a sentence has been given in Active/Passive voice. Out of the four alternatives suggested, select the one which best expresses the same sentence in Passive/Active voice.
The carpenters will take a month's time to make the furniture.
OP1: A month's time is took by the carpenters to make the furniture.
OP2: The carpenters to make the furniture will take a month's time.
OP3: A month's time will be taken by the carpenters to make the furniture.
OP4: Making of the furniture by the carpenters will take a month's time.
Solution:
Here the correct answer is A month's time will be taken by the carpenters to make the furniture.
Key Points:-
  • The given sentence is in the Active voice, therefore, it must be changed to the Passive voice.
  • In order to do that, we need to follow the given steps:-
  • The subject of the active voice 'the carpenters' will become the object of the passive voice.
  • The object of the active voice 'a month's time' will become the subject of the passive voice.
  • Since modal verb 'will' has been used, active voice and passive voice will follow the given structure:-
    • Active Voice - Subject + modal verb + V1 + Object.
    • Passive Voice - Object + modal verb + be + V3 + Subject.
  • For Example:-
    • Active Voice - I may solve this sum.
    • Passive Voice - This sum may be solved by me.
  • Thus, 'will take' (modal verb + V1) will become 'will be taken' (modal verb + be + V3).

Thus, the same sentence in the Passive voice is A month's time will be taken by the carpenters to make the furniture.
Additional Information
  • When we convert active voice to passive voice, three things need to be kept in mind:-
    • Change object into subject.
    • Change subject into object.
    • Always use the third form of the verb in the passive voice.
    • Use 'by' before the new object.

Question:
In the following question, a sentence has been given in Direct/Indirect speech. Out of the four alternatives suggested, select the one which best expresses the same sentence in Indirect/Direct speech.
"I always drink warm water in the morning," she said to me.

OP2: She told me she always drank warm water in the morning.
OP3: She told me she always drunk warm water in the morning.
OP4: She told me that she had always drank warm water in the morning.
Solution:
The correct answer is 'She told me that she always drinks warm water in the morning.Key Points
  • While changing the narration of an assertive sentence, we need to follow the given steps-
    • The conjunction 'that' should be used in place of a comma (,) and inverted commas (“ ”).
    • 'Said to' will be changed into 'told'.
    • If reported speech is a historical event, universal truth, phrase, idiom, proverb, habitual action or scientific fact, the tense of the reported speech does not change.
  • The reported speech shows the habitual action with the given phrase- 'always'
Correct Sentence: She told me that she always drinks warm water in the morning.

  • एक assertive sentence का narration बदलते समय, हमें दिए गए चरणों का पालन करना होगा-
    • Comma (,) और inverted commas (" ") के स्थान पर conjunction 'that' का प्रयोग किया जाना चाहिए।
    • 'Said to' को 'told' में बदल दिया जाएगा।
    • यदि reported speech एक historical event, universal truth, phrase, idiom, proverb, habitual action or scientific fact है तो reported speech का tense नहीं बदलता है।

OP1: To my wound I applied my Band-aid by myself.
OP2: Band-aid by myself would be applied to the wound.
OP3: Application of the Band-aid to the wound was done my me.
OP4: Band-aid was applied by me to the wound.
Solution:
The given sentence is in the Active voice, as the form of the verb (‘applied’) shows that its subject (‘I’) was doing something and was ‘active’.
Therefore, it must be changed to the Passive voice, where something could be done by the subject, and it was ‘passive’.
In order to do that,
1. The object of the transitive verb in the Active voice should become the subject of the verb in the Passive voice (‘Band-aid’ becomes the subject in place of ‘I’).
2. Add the appropriate form of the verb 'be' to the sentence and use the past participle of the verb.
3. Add a 'by' followed by the doer of the action.
Thus, the same sentence in the Passive voice is 'Band-aid was applied by me to the wound.'

Question:

Therefore, it must be changed to the Passive voice, where something could be done by the subject, and it was ‘passive’.
In order to do that,
1. The object of the transitive verb in the Active voice should become the subject of the verb in the Passive voice (‘food’ becomes the subject in place of ‘I’).
2. Add the appropriate form of the verb 'be' to the sentence and use the past participle of the verb (‘cook’ is converted to 'cooked').

Thus, the same sentence in the Passive voice is ‘Food is always cooked by me in olive oil’.

Question:

Solution:
The error is in the first part of the sentence.

Question:

You occasionally stop to admire the intellectual (1)/ scenery, or you sometimes retrace your steps (2)/ to make sure you had seen everything. (3)/ No error (4)

Question:

Q: Our country had earlier faced the problem with our neighbours backed defence hackers jamming or troop movement communication system giving false command and creating a situation of uncertainty.

S: The National Security Council is already in touch with server ministries like home, defence, communication, oil and natural gas, etc. to draw up plans.
Solution:
The correct answer is option 1 i.e. QPSR.
Q is the first sentence of the paragraph as it introduces the theme of the passage i.e. the problem faced by our country
P must follow Q as it tells that taking problems mentioned in Q as example, we must set-up an action plan on a war-footing.
S is the sentence which should follow P as it elaborates what National Security Council is doing.
R is thus the concluding statement.

Question:
In the following question, some part of the sentence may have errors. Find out which part of the sentence has an error and select the appropriate option. If a sentence is free from error, select 'No Error'.
The professor recently describes 1500 tests (1)/ in which blind people passed with greater (2)/ ease than those who could see! (3)/ No error (4)
Solution:
The error is in the first part of the sentence.
The general tense of the sentence is past tense while the tense in the first part of the sentence is present tense. Hence, the required change must be made. The verb ‘describes’ must be replaced with ‘described’ to make the sentence grammatically correct.
Therefore, the correct sentence will be: The professor recently described 1500 tests in which blind people passed with greater ease than those who could see!

Question:
In the following question, a sentence has been given in Direct/Indirect speech. Out of the four alternatives suggested, select the one which best expresses the same sentence in Indirect/Direct speech.
I said to my father, "I had a great time yesterday."
OP1: I told my father that I had a great time the day before.
OP2: I told my father that I have had a great time the day before.
OP3: I told my father that I had a great time the day before that day.
OP4: I told my father this that I have had a great time yesterday.
Solution:
The given sentence is in Direct Speech.
The given sentence is in Direct Speech because it quotes actual words. Therefore, it must be changed into Indirect Speech.
We notice that the reporting verb is in the Past tense (‘said’). Hence, a change will be made in the tense of the reported speech.
Also, the first person of the reported speech is changed according to the subject of reporting speech.
In the given question, ‘yesterday’ is changed into ‘the day before’.
Therefore, the sentence in Indirect Speech will be option 1 i.e. I told my father that I had a great time the day before.

Question:
Read the passage carefully and choose the best answer to each question out of the four alternatives.
In mid-2012 I completed my first massive online open course or MOOC, the kind widely offered by Coursera, EdX, Udacity and so on in partnership with different educational institutions. It was on clinical trials and ethical practices, offered by Johns Hopkins, on Coursera. This was shortly before the MOOC sensation hit India, and when Coursera, which was founded by two Stanford professors, itself was just a few months old. The MOOC bug had bitten me. The course I’d completed was mainly designed for health care professionals who would be involved in actual clinical trials, not college students who had no prior knowledge of that area. I decided to enroll in the course because it was the only biology related course open at the time. However, I did see hope in that sometime in the future I’d be able to get a glimpse of what classes are like in the hallowed halls of major educational institutions around the world. By early 2013, Coursera and EdX had partnered with so many educational institutions and expanded their course offerings to include everything from food and nutrition to Greek mythology to business, that I was spoilt for choice. I spent hours going through course catalogs and poring over course descriptions, almost delirious with excitement at the fact that I was actually going to be able to take classes offered by universities I had only dreamt of attending.

Question:
Which of the following is the name of a university and not an online education delivery company?
Solution:
The correct option is option 2.
From a close reading of the passage, it is clear that Johns Hopkins is the name of a university and Coursera is an online education company.

Question:
Read the passage carefully and select the best answer to each question out of the given four alternatives.
It was for long the insurmountable peak for ODI batting, but one man might now have a template to score ODI double-centuries again and again. In Bengaluru, against Australia in 2013, Rohit Sharma reached 20 off the 35th ball, 50 off the 71st, and the hundred in the 38th over of the innings. In Kolkata, against Sri Lanka in 2014, he was nearly caught for 4 off the 17th ball he faced, reached his 20th run off the 35th ball, but accelerated slightly earlier to bring up his century in the 32nd over of the innings. On a cold mid-week afternoon in Mohali this season, he was even slower to start, reaching 20 off 37 balls, 50 off 65 balls, and bringing up the hundred only in the 40th over. All three were ODI doubles. One time can be a charm, but to accelerate so crazily three times after having set up the innings and to make it look predictable is a perfect combination of skill, fitness and the right mental approach to ODI batting. You can be all amazed at how he manages to do it, but Rohit's reaction to it is typically relaxed. "That's my template, no?" he tends to ask. He remembers the innings clearly: reaching "50 off 70 balls", bringing up the hundred "near the 40th over", and then knowing that the bowlers can't get him out unless he makes a mistake. "That is my style of play," Rohit said. "You are set and seeing the ball nice and hard and you have understood what the bowlers are trying to do by then, and it's all about trying to play with the field once you get past 100. It's all about you not making a mistake and getting out. I am not saying it's impossible or difficult, but it's very unlikely the bowlers are going to get you out once you have scored a hundred. "So it was all about me not making a mistake and batting as long as possible. That's what I did. There is no secret or formula to it. You just have to bat and not make any mistake. The ground is good, the pitch is nice and hard, so you can trust the bounce and play the shots."

Question:
Rohit Sharma hit century in which over in the match against Sri Lanka in Kolkata?
Solution:
The correct answer is option 3 i.e. 32nd.
It can be deduced from the following line of the passage: ‘In Kolkata, against Sri Lanka in 2014, he was nearly caught for 4 off the 17th ball he faced, reached his 20th run off the 35th ball, but accelerated slightly earlier to bring up his century in the 32nd over of the innings’.
